column4: Question: My mozilla thunderbird don't get my e-mails automatically. Only if i open the application. I'm using Ubuntu 12.04.. Is there a way to fix it or an alternative program that runs well on Ubuntu?
he may be thinking of evolution
and evolution is shown on the mail thingy next to my clock?
should do, yes; if you mean check mail etc under the envelope icon
yes. I'll install it, thanks. By the way, evolution is the native e-mail client on kubuntu, right?
not sure on that; perhaps ask in #kubuntu
well thank you very much :)
its kmail iirc
no need to repaste so quickly, give us a moment to check for the answer
i'm sorry.
i don't know :x
then check
how can i check that? :x
oh, found it. going to install it now :D
sudo apt-get install evolution-indicator from the terminal
done. I installed it. I'll be notificated now when i receive an email?
could you pm me? :x
ask in channel

i did. i'm just a bit slow to write .. I will be recieve a notification now? becouse i mean, there is an option "mail" that won't work now. That thing i installed just made the evolution name be shown on that notification icon :x
and you fully set up evolution?
well, i guess i did.
